Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a land habitat and label the different living things found there (e.g., trees, bushes, animals like squirrels or ants).
The student can draw a water habitat and label the different living things found there (e.g., fish, plants, and other aquatic animals like clams).
The student can compare and label patterns of plant and animal diversity across the two habitats.
The student can observe and illustrate how different living things are suited to each habitat.
The student can organize the drawing to clearly show the diversity of life in the two different habitats.
